Windlord::

Windlord opened com link with her and said "Who's Neutronic??? are 
you friend or enemy?? "

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> 
wrote:
> The fighter closed in on the Maximal base.  It pulled up, and 
transformed.  Its two engine sections straighten out, forming 
feminine legs ending feet.  It's feet were that like high heels.  
The waist rotated 180 degrees, the two projections off the sides 
racheted forward, the landing claw folding back, hands pushed rom 
the wrists, forming the arms.  The nose completely detached, the 
smooth rounde section atache to the left forearm, making a sheild.  
The very end of the nose was the sword of this hunter, in its 
ightful place, the ight hand.  The head popped from the shoulders 
and spun around.  The optics lit, and Organics decended.
> "I am Organics.  I am a bounty hunter, I have searche the known 
univese, and now I have found that which I seek here.  Please send 
out Neutronics."
> 
> airly2000 <silvanna2002@h...> wrote:
> Winldord:
> 
> Alarms started to rang and sistems to alert MAximals that 
somethign 
> was arriving at thier base.
> 
> Windlord who was helpin to attend Nioghlight, left them and ran 
> towards computer and typing some buttons started to trak the 
> direction where the new comer will arrive.
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> 
> wrote:
> > Through a rift in space and time, a lone small spacecraft 
> emerged.  It was really a fighter with a long range booster.  It 
> came online and accessed the booster's long range sensors.  It 
> detected several things: multiple bases planet side, and the 
looming 
> Unicron in high orbit.  The craft banke, and made way for the far 
> side of the planet, away from Unicron.  It skimmed across the 
> atmosphere and then entered the atmosphere.  It was going to come 
> down somewhee between all the bases.  After re-entry, the booster 
> section jetisoned and the fighter spread its wings and touched off 
> the engines.  It was then it detected the signal it was looking 
> for.  It was coming fom a base with many Maximal signatures.
> > <I have found him!  At long last, I found him!>
> > It altered course and bee- lined for the Maximal base.  
> > 
> >
